justifications: In last week's EU referendum their feelings were clear, with 75.6 percent voting to leave - the highest percentage in the UK.
"We can not sustain the amount of people we have got here," says Nick, a 61-year-old night porter at the New England Hotel who voted to leave.

Everywhere you go, public services are being cut and yet the number of migrants is increasing. The amount of alcohol consumed in the town is probably five times what it was 10 years ago. They drink on the streets, they urinate up the walls, up the trees, in corners, they defecate in the bushes in the park. It might be good for their country but we are a civilised country and it does not go down well.
